title: Xanthophyll
summary: Xanthophylls (originally phylloxanthins) are yellow pigments that occur widely in nature and form one of two major divisions of the carotenoid group; the other division is formed by the carotenes. The name is from Greek xanthos (ξανθός, "yellow")[1] and phyllon (φύλλον, "leaf"),[2] due to their formation of the yellow band seen in early chromatography of leaf pigments.
